return_description: An NSScanner object that scans aString according to the user’s default locale.

Methods.method_description: Returns an NSScanner object that scans a given string according to the user’s default locale.

return_description: true if the receiver scanned any characters, otherwise false.

Methods.method_description: Scans the string as long as characters from a given character set are encountered, accumulating characters into a string that’s returned by reference.

return_description: true if the receiver scanned any characters, otherwise false.

Methods.method_description: Scans the string until a character from a given character set is encountered, accumulating characters into a string that’s returned by reference.

return_description: true if string matches the characters at the scan location, otherwise false.

Methods.method_description: Scans a given string, returning an equivalent string object by reference if a match is found.

return_description: true if the receiver scans any characters, otherwise false.

Methods.method_description: Scans the string until a given string is encountered, accumulating characters into a string that’s returned by reference.

return_description: true if the receiver finds a valid NSDecimal representation, otherwise false.

Methods.method_description: Scans for an NSDecimal value, returning a found value by reference.

return_description: true if the receiver finds a valid floating-point representation, otherwise false. Overflow or underflow are both considered valid floating-point representations.

Methods.method_description: Scans for a double value, returning a found value by reference.

return_description: true if the receiver finds a valid floating-point representation, otherwise false. Overflow or underflow are both considered valid floating-point representations.

Methods.method_description: Scans for a float value, returning a found value by reference.

return_description: true if the receiver finds a valid double-point representation, otherwise false. Overflow or underflow are both considered valid floating-point representations.

Methods.method_description: Scans for a double value from a hexadecimal representation, returning a found value by reference.

return_description: true if the receiver finds a valid float-point representation, otherwise false. Overflow or underflow are both considered valid floating-point representations.

Methods.method_description: Scans for a double value from a hexadecimal representation, returning a found value by reference.

return_description: Returns true if the receiver finds a valid hexadecimal integer representation, otherwise false. Overflow is considered a valid hexadecimal integer representation.

Methods.method_description: Scans for an unsigned value from a hexadecimal representation, returning a found value by reference.

return_description: true if the receiver finds a valid hexadecimal long long representation, otherwise false. Overflow is considered a valid hexadecimal long long representation.

Methods.method_description: Scans for a long long value from a hexadecimal representation, returning a found value by reference.

return_description: true if the receiver finds a valid integer representation, otherwise false. Overflow is considered a valid integer representation.

Methods.method_description: Scans for an NSInteger value from a decimal representation, returning a found value by reference

return_description: true if the receiver finds a valid decimal integer representation, otherwise false. Overflow is considered a valid integer representation.

Methods.method_description: Scans for an int value from a decimal representation, returning a found value by reference.

return_description: true if the receiver finds a valid decimal integer representation, otherwise false. Overflow is considered a valid decimal integer representation.

Methods.method_description: Scans for a long long value from a decimal representation, returning a found value by reference.

return_description: true if the receiver finds a valid decimal integer representation, otherwise false. Overflow is considered a valid decimal integer representation.

Methods.method_description: Scans for an unsigned long long value from a decimal representation, returning a found value by reference.

Vars.var_description: The string the scanner will scan.
The character position at which the receiver will begin its next scanning operation.
Flag that indicates whether the receiver distinguishes case in the characters it scans.
Character set containing the characters the scanner ignores when looking for a scannable element.
The locale to use when scanning.
Flag that indicates whether the receiver has exhausted all significant characters.

class_description:
A Scanner object interprets and converts the characters of a String into number and string values. You assign the scanner’s string when you create the scanner, and the scanner progresses through the characters of that string from beginning to end as you request items. 
Because of the nature of class clusters, a scanner object isn’t an actual instance of the Scanner class, but is one of its private subclasses. Although a scanner object’s class is private, its interface is public, as declared by this abstract superclass, Scanner. The objects you create using this class are referred to as scanner objects (and when no confusion will result, merely as scanners). 
To set a Scanner object to ignore a set of characters as it scans the string, use the charactersToBeSkipped property. Characters in the skip set are skipped over before the target is scanned. The default set of characters to skip is the whitespace and newline character set.
To retrieve the unscanned remainder of the string, use scanner.string.substring(from: scanner.scanLocation).
